channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #200
item.content:encoded:
#200 - dec 5th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Sequence
Creative digital agency in Cardiff and London UK. Cool effect on the home.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Crypto 101
Introductory course on cryptography, freely available for programmers of all skill levels.
CyberChef
Intuitive web app for analysing and decoding data without having to deal with complex tools or programming languages
Stamplay
Integrate APIs and automate tasks across on-premise, cloud apps and databases.
CSS Reference
A free visual guide to CSS

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ansible: Ruby on Rails Server (Ubuntu 16.x)
Use this ansible playbook to setup a fresh server.
Cyclotron
A web application for constructing dashboards.
wapiti-ruby
Fast Conditional Random Fields API for for sequence segmentation and labelling in Ruby.
Zeal
An offline documentation browser.
GitPlex
A featureful Git GUI.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
The European Ruby Revolution nov 27
While RailsConf is a huge thing in the US, there hasn’t been a European RailsConf since 2008.
Who Called Git? An Unusual Debugging Story nov 28
A lighter bug hunt story.
What’s the Second Job of a Startup CEO? nov 29
When startup CEOs start to scale their companies, they need to redefine themselves and their roles or risk stunting the potential of their startups.
How To Make A DSL, Hygienically nov 30
Domain Specific Languages (DSLs) are custom-made computer languages, designed to be convenient for specific tasks.
Loops in CSS Preprocessors dec 2
If you're not sure when to use loops in your code, keep an eye out for repetition.
DevRant: Appreciating Quality Geek Humor dec 2
LSometimes you just need to rant. Fortunately, there’s an app for that. It’s called devRant.
I wrote an address tokenizer using machine learning dec 2
A first step of machine learning by using CRF model for address parsing in Ruby.
Gem Release: Google Analytics Chrome Developer Cookie dec 3
Want to add easily configurable google analytics tracking code to your Rails application, but not register you and your development team’s clicks and views?
How to detect image contents from Ruby with Amazon Rekognition dec 4
Rekognition is a new Amazon Web Service that “makes it easy to add image analysis to your applications.”
How Font Awesome 5 Became Kickstarter’s Most Funded Software Project dec 4
Given the chance to go back in time, there are a few things we might do differently.

item.title: Green Ruby News #199
item.content:encoded:
#199 - nov 27th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Violent Shell
Web site in shell style.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Pinebook
A Low Cost Linux Laptop That Looks Like A MacBook.
Rails SQL Injection Examples
Things to prevent when taking pramams directly to your Rails query.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
CardsLib
Card evaluation is written in a functional way that allows, and is optimized for, lazy evaluation.
Stub_server
Boot up a real server to serve testing replies.
Dante2
A rewrite of dante editor built on top of DraftJs
Refinerycms
An extendable Ruby on Rails CMS that supports Rails 4.2+

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Ruby 2.3.3 Released nov 21
This release contains a bug fix about Refinements and Module#prepend.
Writing a Rails Feature - Blow by Blow nov 21
A detailed walkthrough on how a Rails core commiter implements a feature.
Style List Markers in CSS nov 21
The trick is to remove the list-style, then apply the markers through pseudo-element counters.
Ruby tips #2 nov 23
Interesting solutions which you’ll not find anywhere else.
Q&A With Piotr Solnica nov 23
Piotr, and developers like him, play the important role of breathing fresh air into our community.
The Double Splat Operator nov 24
It allows you to capture an indefinite number of named arguments or a hash right after capturing an array of arguments.
Random Interesting Facts on HTML/SVG usage nov 25
Interesting facts on markup usage.

item.title: Green Ruby News #198
item.content:encoded:
#198 - nov 20th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Bakken and Bæck
Digital studio website.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Nextcloud Box
Portable 1TB private cloud.
Webhook Tester
Test webhooks with your own unique test URL.
Kill the newsletter!
Make newsletters become RSS feeds.
Awesome-Hacking
A collection of various awesome lists for hackers, pentesters and security researchers

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.3.2 Released nov 15
This release contains update of RubyGems 2.5.2 and update of included ssl certificates along with other bug fixes.
wayback-machine-downloader
Download an entire website from the Wayback Machine.
whitewidow
SQL Vulnerability Scanner
envchain
Environment variables meet OS X Keychain and gnome-keyring.
Rocker
Rocker breaks the limits of Dockerfile.
Minio
Object storage server built for cloud application developers and devops

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Deploying Rails on Kubernetes nov 13
How to deploy and orchestrate a Rails 5 application with Kubernetes in Google Container Engine (GKE)
Statistical Literacy and You: An Intro for Programmers nov 14
Very seldom do we consider the ethical implications of how we are producing and showing that data.
A Rubyist's Guide to Big-O Notation nov 14
You would expect that processing an array of 100 items would be slower than an array of 10 items. But by how much?
Rack-App: A Performant and Pragmatic Web Microframework nov 14
Rack makes it incredibly easy for anyone with a basic grasp of TCP/IP to roll their own framework.
Replacing the Rails Asset Pipeline with Webpack and Yarn nov 15
Rails no longer needs to control the entire ecosystem, and arguably it shouldn’t because tools have been developed which do a better job.
Node.js Garbage Collection Explained nov 15
Learn how Node.js garbage collection and memory management works in practice. Code-level explanation and garbage collection examples inside.
Rails Database Best Practices nov 16
Reducing the number of queries, using indexes, or any of the other suggestions aren’t premature optimizations IMHO. It’s using your database correctly.
Adding and Leveraging a CDN on Your Website nov 16
If you’ve been working around web development for a while, you’ll know that the web has a need for speed.
15kb of CSS is all you’ll ever need nov 17
We have a CSS problem.
Native Browser Copy To Clipboard nov 18
It wasn't that long ago where you couldn't programmatically copy text to the clipboard from the web without using Flash.
Ruby Elixir Nodejs Tools Comparison Matrix nov 20
The toolboxes for different languages are quite similar.

item.title: Green Ruby News #197
item.content:encoded:
#197 - nov 13th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Circles Conference
Circles is a creative design conference where designers can learn from world-changing thinkers and innovators for the creative community.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
RubyConf Taiwan 2016
As usual Matz will be there.
Snyk
Fix/Alert known vulnerabilities in Node.js and Ruby apps on Github.
DevFreeBooks
A collection of free books for developers
HeadlessBrowsers
A list of (almost) all headless web browsers in existence.
Submit.co
Where to get press coverage for your startup: list of websites.
Vocalizer
Vocalizer is a web accessibility tool for people with difficult to pronounce names.
Hyper.sh
Deploy your container apps in 5 sec!

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
manpages
Add man pages support to ruby gems.
Lynis
Security auditing tool for Linux, macOS, and UNIX-based systems.
RackHD
Stack for enabling automated hardware management and orchestration through cohesive APIs.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Microservice Communication with Queues nov 9
Microservices work together by communicating messages back and forth so that they can accomplish the larger task.
Ruby 2.4.0-preview3 Released nov 9
Various performance improvements.
How to build a network stack in Ruby nov 10
Learning about sockets, datagrams, bit-twiddling and more.
7 Design Patterns to Refactor MVC Components in Rails nov 10
Refactoring patterns with examples.
Ruby 3x3: Matz, Koichi, and Tenderlove on the future of Ruby Performance nov 10
An interview with Matz and Tenderlove on Ruby 3.
Ruby 2.4 and captured data from Regexp match results nov 10
Ruby 2.4 adds support for extracting named captures and positional capture groups from Regexp match results
The Power of the rgba() Color Function in CSS nov 10
Ability to do color manipulations right in the browser.

item.title: Green Ruby News #196
item.content:encoded:
#196 - nov 06th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Jenny Johannesson
Portfolio of Jenny Johannesson, Designer.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Websites made simple
A simpler way to make a website for anything.
Wrenchmode
Dead Simple Maintenance pages for your web app.
The Ultimate Guide to Remote Work
Downloadable guide for remote working.
StockJo
Collection of free stock stuff.
All Day DevOps
15 time zones. 15 hours. 54 sessions. nov 15th.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Manpages
This plugin will add man pages support to ruby gems.
Blazer
Business intelligence made simple: Explore your data with SQL.
Groupdate
The simplest way to group temporal data
Lighthouse
Auditing and performance metrics for Progressive Web Apps
Funcssion
set of really simple CSS classes, with a single purpose, inspired by the philosophy behind pure functions.
Portier
An email-based, passwordless authentication service

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Using DTrace to measure mutex contention in Ruby oct 31
This type of information can be worth its weight in gold when trying to diagnose why your threaded program is running slower than expected.
Service discovery at Stripe oct 31
At Stripe, Consul helps discover services.
FizzBuzz In Too Much Detail nov 1
Complexity is like a mortgage – you’re going to be paying interest on it.
Announcing Dart Sass noc 1
A new engine for Sass, in dart ... (doh)
Puppet Query Language nov 1
Introduction to PQL, still experimental but enabled by default in recent puppet versions.
Ruby 2.4 implements Enumerable#sum nov 2
Ruby 2.4.0 implements Enumerable#sum as part of the language itself.
10 principles for smooth web animations nov 2
The complete guide to 60fps smooth animations on your website.
5 systemd Tools You Should Start Using Now nov 2
Systemd sucks, but it takes over the world. Better get used to it.
Top 10 Quick Rails Performance Wins nov 4
In the beginning, Rails performance was really looked down on and wasn't really defended.
Building a Better Mobile Crash Analytics Platform nov 4
Collecting mobile crashes and exceptions is (of necessity) quite different from most error reporting on the web.

item.title: Green Ruby News #195
item.content:encoded:
#195 - oct 30th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Bolden
Design agency based in Amsterdam, specialised in web applications.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Sqreen
Runtime security monitoring & protection tool for web apps.
Awesome-selfhosted
This is a list of Free Software network services and web applications which can be hosted locally.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
HexaPDF
A Versatile PDF Creation and Manipulation Library for Ruby.
execjs-fastnode
A faster Node.JS integration for Ruby/Rails ExecJS.
keight
Jet-speed webapp framework.
ApiPresenter
Return associations and policies with API responses
Clusterize.js
Tiny plugin to display large data sets easily
Bedrock
Rock solid distributed database specializing in active/active automatic failover and WAN replication/
Box
A Next-Generation Builder for Docker Images (mruby syntax, go compilation).

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Row Fragmentation: Share the Mutex oct 25
The concept of fragmentation is sort of like having multiple bartenders working a bar.
Spoooooky CSS Selectors oct 26
Let's get into the spirit a little bit this year with some Halloween themed posts!
Continuous Integration with Bitbucket Pipelines oct 30
Bitbucket Pipelines is now publicly available and enables you to easily add Continuous Integration as well as Deployment.
Monitoring Sidekiq Using AWS Lambda and Slack oct 25
We found AWS Lambda to be a lightweight solution to tie the monitoring of Sidekiq and notifications in Slack together.
SEO Title Tag Optimization at Etsy oct 25
This post explains the methodology behind our SEO testing, the challenges we have come across, and how we have resolved them.
Using MySQL 5.7 On Codeship oct 26
Why MySQL 5.7? Because it finally has support for JSON queries.
Riding into the Danger Zone: Virtual Hackathons for Virtual Teams oct 26
A personal report from a hackathon rush time.
Why Learning Rails Is Still a Great Choice in 2016 oct 27
Some good points on why ruby still has it's place in programming.
DTrace for Linux 2016 oct 27
In new linux kernels (4.9+) we can finaly trace things the DTrace way.
Why you should use a single repository for all your company’s projects oct 29
Breaking down the benefits of monorepo.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
What Seasoned Developers Should Know About Learning Elixir oct 25
If you're a seasoned developer but new to Elixir, here are three talks worth watching.

item.title: Green Ruby News #194
item.content:encoded:
#194 - oct 23th 2016

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Awesome-frontend
Just a list of links.
Dockbit
Software deployments into repeatable, manageable workflows.
Dirty COW
CVE-2016-5195, a very nasty Linux kernel vuln. With a name, a website, and a logo, again

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Procodile
Procodile is a bit like Foreman but things are designed to run in the background.
EM Midori
EM Midori is an EventMachine-based Web Framework written in pure Ruby, providing high performance and proper abstraction.
sql_tracker
Rails SQL Query Tracker
i18n_yaml_sorter
An I18n YAML deep sorter that keeps locales organized without messing text formating
errdo
A simple plugin to handle, log, and customize production errors in Rails applications

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Learn Ruby Metaprogramming for Great Good oct 17
A clean example of good metaprogramming in Ruby.
Running Ruby apps in production oct 17
Procodile is an easy to use and understand solution for Ruby developers who just want to define a process list and type start to get it up and running without any fuss.
How to Manage Application Secrets in EC2 oct 17
Amazon's Key Management Service (KMS) provides an API for interacting with encryption keys.
When To Be Concerned About Concerns oct 18
Once our chunk of behavior starts pushing the scroll-to-understand-it boundary, we give in and move it to a separate file.
How we deploy at npm oct 19
Here’s how we deploy node services at npm: git push origin +master:deploy-production

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
EuRuKo 2016 - Day 1 Keynote by Yukihiro Matz Matsumoto oct 19
What about on Ruby 3.

item.title: Green Ruby News #193
item.content:encoded:
#193 - oct 16th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Offf - Italia
Pretty neat navigation trick

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
You might not need Javascript
You can build so many functional UI components without the additional dependency.
Bitwarden
Store and sync password across devices.
SQL style guide by Simon Holywell
A consistent code style guide for SQL to ensure legible and maintainable projects.
Your Social Media Fingerprint
Any website can detect on which platforms you're signed up (mostly on chrome, and a little less on firefox).
The Open Guide to Amazon Web Services
A huge practical guide.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
mastodon
A GNU Social-compatible microblogging server
botstack
Rapid FB chatbot development with ruby on rails.
Nodejs-dashboard
Telemetry dashboard for node.js apps from the terminal!
glean
A tiny bitmap font for programming
Git-Repo
utility for managing services
Resinos
Run Docker containers on embedded devices

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Refine Your Ruby Util Objects oct 9
Use refine to do monkey patch with monkey.
Euruko 2016 - Ruby is dead, long live Ruby! oct 10
What can we expect for ruby 3?
Diving into How Hashes Work in Ruby oct 10
By far the largest costs in hashing are the rehashing, hash calculation, and bucketing.
Wasting Time TDDing The Wrong Things oct 11
Use top-down approach to prevent refactoring your test all the time.
How we save money by using DDD and Process Managers oct 11
A clever payment management system.
How to generate and add sitemap to your Rails Application oct 11
SitemapGenerator gem is the easiest way to generate Sitemaps in Ruby.
Exploring CLI Best Practices oct 12
List of best practices they use at Localytics.
How kubeadm Initializes Your Kubernetes Master oct 12
kubeadm is a new tool that is part of the Kubernetes distribution as of 1.4.0
Yarn Package Manager: An Improvement over npm oct 13
Yarn is the newest package manager on the block with speed and improvements over npm.
We need JavaScript to fix the web oct 15
Own the responsibility to work around JS flaky nature and reliability issues.

item.title: Green Ruby News #192
item.content:encoded:
#192 - oct 9th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
RSQ
An award-winning digital agency.
GitHub Audio
The music of github events.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Dead Man's Switch
Set up emails to be sent out after your death.
Cat Ipsum
Litter your copy with more kitty using this furrier alternative to Lorem Ipsum.
Art of README
Learn the art of writing quality READMEs.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Hyperloop
Ruby frontend libraries. Write React in ruby.
Faker
A library for generating fake data such as names, addresses, and phone numbers.
whirly
Colorful Terminal Spinner for Ruby.
Central
An agile project planning tool and Pivotal Tracker drop-in replacement
Fukol
A grid framework that holds in a tweet, with an attitude.
Typora
A minimal markdown editor.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Beware the ORM: Locking and Joins oct 2
Knowing how original SQL generated by ORM and how it interacts with Rails is important.
Sharing models between Rails Apps oct 3
For some situations you can organize your models logic into Ruby modules then move them out to a Rubygem.
Parslet oct 3
Parslet allows you to write a parser that will take the input String (our query) and create a syntax tree.
How it feels to learn JavaScript in 2016 oct 3
What does it feel like to be a modern front end engineer.
Building a Rack Web Server in Ruby oct 4
Rack is an interface for structuring web applications using Ruby.
Ruby Versions Used in Commercial Projects, 2016 Edition oct 4
Most people are starting with the latest versions.
Test-Driven Development oct 5
This painstaking study is the latest in a long line to find that test-driven development (TDD) has little or no impact on development time or code quality.
Let The Asset Pipeline Die oct 5
Rails hate against javascript is deranged.

item.title: Green Ruby News #191
item.content:encoded:
#191 - oct 2nd 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Google Web Fonts Typographic Project
This collaborative, ongoing project offers inspiration for using Google’s font library

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
The Complete Guide to Rails Performance
(book) full-stack course to make Ruby on Rails applications faster, more scalable, and simpler to maintain
Figma
Collaborative interface design tool.
text-spinners
This project tries to mimic command line spinners like those from cli-spinners and bring them to the web.
Jpeg.io
Convert any major image format into a highly optimized JPEG
Todo-Backend
a shared example to showcase backend tech stacks
Opentest
A Chrome extension for easy video creation and sharing.
Security blogs
A list of security blogs.
SourceClear
Automatic security scanning of your open source dependencies, hooked right into your build tools and repositories.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Formular
Form builder for Ruby. Fast, Furious, and Framework-Agnostic.
Babushka
Tool for automating computing chores. test-driven sysadmin.
DecentExposure
A helper for creating declarative interfaces in controllers
SitemapGenerator
Framework-agnostic XML Sitemap generator written in Ruby with automatic Rails integration.
Searchkick
Intelligent search made easy with Rails and Elasticsearch
Publify
A self hosted Web publishing platform on Rails.
MetaTags
Search Engine Optimization (SEO) for Ruby on Rails applications.
ActiveJob::Retriable
Automatically retry failed ActiveJobs
Trado
Lightweight, easy to use ecommerce platform.
fastlane
The easiest way to automate building and releasing your iOS and Android apps
Choreographer-js
A simple library to take care of complex CSS animations.
Cleanslate
Extreme CSS reset stylesheet.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Decoding Rails Magic: How Does ActiveJob Work? sep 25
ActiveJob, which provides extra layer on top of background jobs framework.
Create a Single Page App With Go, Echo and Vue sep 26
Create a speedy single page application using the power of Go and VueJS
Rebase and merge pull requests sep 26
Use the merge button to rebase and merge your changes on Github PRs.
Concurrency in Ruby 3 with Guilds sep 27
A proposal for a new concurrent and parallel mechanism in Ruby called Guilds.
Introducing Tensorflow Ruby API sep 27
TensorFlow is an extraordinary open source software library for numerical computation using data flow graphs.
Simple Authentication for one user in Rails sep 29
For really simple website where admin is just one person, using authentication gem like Devise may be overkill.
Karafka 0.5.0 release details sep 29
Ruby + Kafka framework, after one year of work.
PostgreSQL 9.6 sep 29
Parallel query, synchronous replication improvements, phrase search, and improvements to performance and usability
45 Ruby Blogs sep 30
A list of recently active ruby blogs.
What does it mean when code is easy to reason about? sep 30
Critically think about code and write programs that are easier to reason about.
Vue 2.0 oct 1
Official release of Vue.js 2.0: Ghost in the Shell. After 8 alphas, 8 betas and 8 rcs.
Parallel rendering in Rails oct 2
Using Pagelets.
